citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee has not had the attending veterinarian visit the facility monthly, as written in the program of vet care. While
the licensee stated the attending vet will frequent the facility monthly in the near future, the attending vet is currently
visiting the facility semiannually. The facility shall include formal arrangements with a written program of veterinary care
for their attending veterinarian consultant arrangements and follow that written guidance.
To be corrected by: 7-July-2023

The facility uses cage cards as the record of acquisition for the dogs born at the facility. There were several litters of
puppies with their dams in Building 2 missing the following information on the cage cards: USDA number, dam’s
microchip number, puppy’s sex, breed, color and any distinct markings.
Accurate acquisition information is necessary for APHIS officials to make positive identification of animals during
inspection and to properly trace their movements. The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain an approved method of
documentation which fully and correctly disclose all information concerning each dog purchased or otherwise acquired,
owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or
otherwise disposed of by that dealer. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her
possession or under his or her control.
The licensee must record the acquisition information on an approved document for all puppies and ensure all required
acquisition information is properly and accurately documented at all times.
To be corrected by: This was corrected at the time of inspection.

The dates for administration of treatment for one dog at the facility were not completed in full. One adult male (MC
#933000320230157) received eye drops for a chronic condition. Although the facility documented the initial management
of eye drops, the remaining dates of duration has not been notated.
Adequate record keeping is necessary to ensure the health of animals and to ensure that the guidance of the attending
veterinarian is being followed. The facility must keep and maintain the names of all vaccines and treatments and the dates
of administration given to dogs at the facility.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
CARLA THOMAS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee has not had the attending veterinarian visit the facility monthly, as written in the program of vet care. While 
the licensee stated the attending vet will frequent the facility monthly in the near future, the attending vet is currently 
visiting the facility semiannually. The facility shall include formal arrangements with a written program of veterinary care 
for their attending veterinarian consultant arrangements and follow that written guidance. 
To be corrected by: 7-July-2023 
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility uses cage cards as the record of acquisition for the dogs born at the facility. There were several litters of 
puppies with their dams in Building 2 missing the following information on the cage cards: USDA number, dam’s 
microchip number, puppy’s sex, breed, color and any distinct markings. 
Accurate acquisition information is necessary for APHIS officials to make positive identification of animals during 
inspection and to properly trace their movements. The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain an approved method of 
documentation which fully and correctly disclose all information concerning each dog purchased or otherwise acquired, 
owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or 
otherwise disposed of by that dealer. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her 
possession or under his or her control. 
The licensee must record the acquisition information on an approved document for all puppies and ensure all required 
acquisition information is properly and accurately documented at all times. 
To be corrected by: This was corrected at the time of inspection. 
3.13(b)(3)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The dates for administration of treatment for one dog at the facility were not completed in full. One adult male (MC 
#933000320230157) received eye drops for a chronic condition. Although the facility documented the initial management 
of eye drops, the remaining dates of duration has not been notated. 
Adequate record keeping is necessary to ensure the health of animals and to ensure that the guidance of the attending 
veterinarian is being followed. The facility must keep and maintain the names of all vaccines and treatments and the dates 
of administration given to dogs at the facility.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
CARLA THOMAS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
